title: LabyrinthCore
author: LabyrinthCore
created_time: November 05, 2022, 10:22:31 PMLast edit: November 15, 2022, 07:41:44 PM by LabyrinthCore
content: Labyrinth - The decentralized escrow platformLabyrinth eliminates the need for trust while transacting on the open blockchain. A complete, decentralized solution based on multisignature and time-locked transactions.Labyrinth Core (LAB) is an open-source, Bitcoin-derived digital currency that serves as the core of our escrow service. It supports the latest features as but not limited to Dersig, Schnorr, and Taproot.Labyrinth Escrow is a platform where multiple parties can transact with each other, under predefined conditions, without the need for trust. This is possible due to conditions being set and executed similarly to smart contracts. The entire transaction validation happens on the chain, rendering the usual escrow attacks impractical.TrustlessTime-locked and multisignature transactions ensure strict execution under predefined conditions.SecureThe platform relies on blockchain consensus rules, ruling out any unauthorized spending.DecentralizedCore transaction logic relies on blockchain nodes, and critical service availability is guaranteed.TimelineQ3 2022Starting development of Labyrinth Core blockchain, Windows, and Linux wallets. Labyrinth Escrow idea is scheduled for finalization. Standalone KAWPoW Stratum module testing.Q4 2022Launching Labyrinth blockchain, the release of wallets. Securing and expanding the network. Labyrinth Escrow idea is finalized, and development is in progress. Standalone KAWPoW Stratum module in BETA.Q1 2023Labyrinth Escrow public BETA available. Exchange and CMC/Coingecko listing. Electrum and SPV wallet development. Custom block explorer and infrastructure.Q2 2023The official launch of Labyrinth Escrow. Android and iOS wallets are in development. Electrum and SPV wallets release. Crypto libraries and API development. Partnerships with established entities.Q3 2023Expanding and adding additional cryptocurrencies to Labyrinth Escrow. Prioritized are Bitcoin, Zcash, and Monero. The rest will be selected by the highest user demand.Blockchain parametersType Proof-Of-WorkAlgorithm KAWPoWRetargeting DGW-20Blocktime 60 secBlock reward 100 LABHalving  1 440 000 blocksMaximum supply 270 000 000 LABFounder payment 10%LinksWebsite https://labyrinthcore.comExplorer https://explorer.labyrinthcore.comGithub https://github.com/LabyrinthCoreDiscord https://discord.gg/qYR8e8vpYsTelegram https://t.me/+F0qsWWd2WvU3MDM8MinersNVIDIA https://github.com/trexminer/T-RexAMD https://github.com/todxx/teamredminerStandalone KAWPoW StratumSource https://github.com/LabyrinthCore/kawpow-stratumPartnersReservedReservedReservedReservedReservedReservedStatshttps://miningpoolstats.stream/labyrinthPoolshttps://newpool.pw/labhttps://pool.rplant.xyz/#labyrinth#connecthttps://asia-pool.com/stats/labyrinth

comments.author: LabyrinthCore
comments.body: Quote from: kamelbendali on November 06, 2022, 03:30:06 PMAfter checking the founders, project, community and everything ! my decision is taken : I don't know how much it will take, maybe, few days, or few months, but this coin will turn to scam quicklyso if you mine it ? it s for profit " sorry for investors " Good luck everyone After checking what you've checked, we've concluded that you didn't check the most important thing, Github. We don't really know what is your development experience, but if you check the code you'll see that this is not just a copy-paste project. Every good developer out there will conclude the same.

comments.author: CmdPrompt24
comments.body: Can you post the link with all of the wallets?  I'm an ubuntu guy.

comments.author: LabyrinthCore
comments.created_time: November 07, 2022, 07:35:06 PMLast edit: November 09, 2022, 04:39:14 AM by LabyrinthCore
comments.body: Quote from: CmdPrompt24 on November 07, 2022, 06:06:51 PMCan you post the link with all of the wallets?  I'm an ubuntu guy. Sure, let me clarify the versioning so it's not confusing.The second argument indicates the version, you should aim for the highest one available.The third argument of the filename indicates the platform for which the release was compiled.The fourth argument indicates whether the wallet has GUI or is command-line only. QT means GUI, daemon means command-line.The last argument indicates the type of executable. P2P has no wallet functionality. It's used to run your own seed node.For exaple if you want to run the GUI wallet on Ubuntu, you need to download labyrinth-v0.1.0-ubuntu-qt.ziphttps://github.com/LabyrinthCore/Labyrinth/releases

comments.author: tyjwwb
comments.body: 我下载了WIN钱包，但是没办法创建新地址，请问是怎么回事呢？

comments.author: LabyrinthCore
comments.body: Quote from: tyjwwb on November 09, 2022, 04:55:58 AM我下载了WIN钱包，但是没办法创建新地址，请问是怎么回事呢？We have two more users complaining from the same issue, however we triple checked and didn't find a cause in the wallet itself for this behaviour. It ts likely that the machine you are installing it on has some misconfigured settings. If you need any further support, or want to share debugging information with us, feel free to join our discord channel!

comments.author: LabyrinthCore
comments.body: For the more experienced users among our community, a series of puzzle transactions will be released later today. The puzzle itself would be contained in the script field of the output, with increasing reward as the puzzle difficulty goes on. If you manage to unlock the output script, the coins are yours!

comments.author: LabyrinthCore

comments.body: Labyrinth project has moved to a new domain due to issues with the registrar. All services are fully operational, however a wallet update is required due to DNS seeds update.
